basics.name: Malisa Lo
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Science in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2025.

work.company: UH Manoa Hawaiian and Public Library
work.summary: Circulate rare Hawaiian and Pacific materials at Hamilton Library
highlights: Preserving and maintaining the conditions of rare Hawaiian and Pacific photographs, maps, documents, and other materials that are found in the library.
Responsible for delivering exceptional customer service and efficiently working with the team to circulate library materials to the community.
Completing monthly statistics of the amount of patrons and materials that was requested from the Hawaiian and Pacific Collections library.

work.summary: Created virtual reality field trips to spread environmental awareness within Oahu.
highlights: Created virtual reality field trips for the different conservation sites around Oahu in order to make learning accessible for individuals who are unable to physically attend because of disabilities, COVID-19, or personal reasons.
Presented at the Hawaii Agriculture Conference and Hawaii Conservation Conference to showcase how virtual reality field trips can bring environmental awareness on the island of Oahu.
Researched environmental issues and solutions being done on conversation sites. These sites include the Nanakuli Wetland, Palehua, and Piliokahe Beach Park.

volunteer.summary: Nānākuli muliwai (estuary) and Piliokahe Beach Park Restoration
highlights: Cleaned up trash in the area.

awards.title: Hawaii Annual Code Challenge 2023, 2nd Place Coded Solution
awards.awarder: The State of Hawaii Office of Enterprise Technology Services
awards.summary: Created a ChatBot using Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning to answer user's ITS related requests. This solution was meant to improve the current ITS AskUs keyword search and reduce Help Desk calls.

awards.title: University of Hawaii at Mānoa Dean’s List
awards.summary: Scholarships awarded to incoming freshmen and continuing students who complete a rigorous high school curriculum with a minimum overall GPA of 3.0 at a Hawai'i public school.

awards.title: Fred and Annie Chan Scholarship Fund for Information and  Computer Sciences
awards.awarder: University of Hawaii at Mānoa - College of Natural Sciences
awards.summary: Awarded to an undergraduate student who expresses a great interest in pursuing a career related to computer software engineering and  technology.

awards.title: Postl Scholarship Fund for the College of Natural Sciences-University of Hawaii at Mānoa
awards.awarder: University of Hawaii at Mānoa - College of Natural Sciences
awards.summary: This scholarship is given to a student who displays great academic accomplishments in their undergraduate career.
